Replies.Reply: I can offer you some Halcyon.
A high risk stunt like that's worth at least a thousand five.
Done.
I managed to get them up to five hundred.

You know how much my business made last year? Thirty Grand. Takes me six months to build a car and a couple of seconds for these jerks to write it off on a stunt that doesn't even make it into the movie.
Let me talk you through it first.
test drivers and a stable of cars.
Sure, but it's not the only way. All I need is a hard-used stock car. We start off with the small-town action then work our way up.
There's a fortune to be made. Sponsorship.
No, thanks.
Four hundred and thirty thousand dollars.
Look, I wouldn't come to you unless I was sure about this.
I got a driver.
Not like this one.
I been working with this guy a long time -
Everything I own is in metal. I had to sell my Bullit car the other day just to pay the gas bill. I'm telling you, Bernie, put this kid behind a wheel there's nothing he can't do.
Looks a little long in the tooth to me.
You gonna give me the four?
Gorgeous day just got even nicer. How can I help you, ma'am?
You boys and girls know each other?
So what seems to be the problem, ma'am?
Don't worry, ma'am, your son'll be fine.
We been together about five years now. He showed up out of the blue one day, no references or nothin', asking me for a job.
I thought maybe we'd take her for a run Thursday or Friday.
Yeah? Why's that?
Irene, huh?
You're seeing quite a lot of the young lady.
Try her out. She's more comfortable than a water bed.
Windshield wipers.
Who was that?
What did I tell you about married women?
You better bring it over.
What did you do with the cash?
You want me to look after it for you?
A friend of mine owes him some money. I was wondering if you knew him?
We're all set for next month.
He's doing great.
What happened?
Let me talk to Bernie again. They probably didn't listen to him -
Thinking about it.
You break in like this I figure it's bad news.
He tried to put it right.
Probably across the border by now. Mexico.
That's gratitude, I guess.
Not this week.
Won't work.
My hands are a little dirty.
You might wanna take a look at the suspension before we go again.
Where do you want me to put them?
I'm okay.
No, I been here a while.
What's he do?
I'm sorry.
I drive.
It's just part-time. Most days I work in a garage.
Reseda Boulevard.
He interested in that kind of stuff?
You think?
Your mom said you like movies?
Ever see the Terminator?
Grease?
Wanna see where it was shot?
I can't make Friday.
I told Irene I'd drive her to Burbank.
What's happening now?
Looks like he's in trouble.
This is pretty complicated. You watching?
Don't worry. I won't complain.
I'm glad.
He's a great kid.
Yeah.
I get by.
I've got some things to do.
Soon.
Don't worry about it.
Call it fifty.
You can't have both.
Something like that Buick over there'll cost you nine grand but there isn't much point in a city where you can't drive faster than sixty five.
I wouldn't know.
Excuse me.
Irene's husband.
I already ate. I just wanted to see how you were?
Can you move?
Why?
How much?
Is that why you need a car?
I didn't.
Why don't you take them away?
You okay?
You want something to drink?
Not if we understand each other.
I drive. That's all I do.
You don't have to do this.
How much did Cook tell you you could expect to net?
The guy saw you grab the money and jump in the car -- why didn't he say anything?
Any idea there'd be another car waiting?
You just got a little kid's father killed.
You were gonna rip us off and split the take?
How long have you known him?
You know his real name?
You're going to take me to him right now, you understand?
It's safe.
Cook moved office again?
Should've figured you for a shill. Who were you fronting for?
Whose money am I holding?
Who's money am I holding?
I have something that belongs to him.
Can I give you a ride?
He was into one of the prison gangs for a lot of money. He was trying to protect you.
I still have the money. Whatever you need -
You will. Once I straighten out this thing I'm getting out for good. We'll go some place. Anywhere you want.
Nino's guys came after me. How did they know about Irene?
They're gonna come after you to find me.
I never asked for any of it.
That's up to you.
She's not interested.
What do you suggest I do?
Nine, ten thousand. If you can find one that still runs.
They won't go higher than a thousand.
Here you go, Mr. Rose.
Egg rolls, chicken chow mein, five flavor shrimp and Peking duck.
Doesn't look like it, sir. Let me run and get the guy.
Did they remember the chop sticks?
How much do you need?
That sounds like a lot.
I don't know anything about car racing but I assume there's a reason for that?
Thank you, Ron. You sure you don't want any of this?
You still haven't given me a number?
Come on, Shannon. How can you be sure? What have you got these big money teams don't have?
And they got half a dozen Drivers you told me.
But you don't have the money.
And what happens to my money if this kid gets hit by a bus?
What's a Jew doing running a Pizzeria?
I thought you were supposed to be out of town anyway?
Be polite, Nino. I invited him here.
Shannon smiles to himself.
I paid for it. Out of my own pocket.
So, when's our first race?
You gonna be ready?
He ever tell you how we met?
I did some producing back in the 80's.
Can you for once say something without the word fuck in it?
You want some coffee?
So, what's your interest in the Seventh Heaven?
It's a strip joint on La Cienega. Your friend Cook runs it. Why're you curious about him all of a sudden?
Yeah, I know him. He's a crazy Albanian. If I were your friend I'd pay up.
You wake me up this early this friend must be a close friend?
How's our car by the way?
And our driver?
Not now that it's bounced up in your face.
You like taking orders, go shut the blinds.
You stole from the East Coast mob?
And where did this punk find a million dollars? You ever consider he may have consulted some higher-ups? You even bother to check? -
Your city? This is a big city, pal, and last time I checked we were partners! -
Well, now you fucked up I am involved.
Those old men gave us the funds to move out here.
The money always flows up, Izzy. You know that.
What about this prick?
Are you asking my permission?
Going somewhere?
I'm looking for your driver.
It's bad luck. Two thousand heists in this city a year, he had to pick the wrong one.
Any idea where he is?
He just walked out on you after everything you've done for him, took all the money?
What's this fucking kid to you anyway?
Bernie Rose, next apartment over -
You all right, Shonda?
What's your fucking name?
I'm a patient man, Lenny, not much for getting in other people's way. What I figure is, we've all got our own lives, right? And the right to be left alone?
So I sit next door for almost a year now listening to what goes down in here and I keep thinking, hey, they'll work it out.
Nino?
Then we should talk. You know a place called the Great Wall -- out on Sherman Way?
The duck, please. For two.
You've been on a roll. Cut yourself quite a swath out there.
Anyway it's water under the bridge now.
You bring the cash?
Tell me something, how does someone with no interest in money get mixed up in a heist?
Shannon told me it was because of the girl?
Don't worry. Nobody else knows about her.
This is what I'll do for you. You give me the money, nobody knows she exists. But it's a different matter with you.
How much does something like this cost?
Maybe I'll take yours. Part of our deal.
Guess we won't be seeing each other again..
What are you doing eating Chink food in my restaurant?
Well, I'm back.
Take a hike. I need to talk to my partner.
Oh, I'm sorry. How you doing, Shannon?
I already got a fucking water bed.
What does this fucking thing do?
What the fuck do you know about married women?
You discuss this with anyone else?
It's not that simple, Bernie.
I stole from a jumped up punk who was gonna step on our business -
I don't give a fuck who gave him their blessing. This is my city -
We are partners -
This was off to the side, Bernie. I didn't wanna involve you.

What family? These fucks still call me a kike to my face. I'm fifty nine years old, they pinch my cheek, treat me like a fuckin' kid. They're the reason we left New York in the first place. Decrepit old men waving us over to their dinner and domino tables to complain.
I pay them half of everything I fucking earn and then they set up some fucking kid from Philadelphia just because he's a fucking wop!
That's why this driver has to go. Him, and maybe your friend Shannon, are the only two people who can tie me to the robbery.
I'm asking for your help. I shoulda' come to you first, Bernie. I know that. We're a team.
I'll pay you back the three hundred you spent on the race car.
Alright honey, I'll pick you up in an hour.
I lost count -
Would you like something to drink?
A glass of water?
You just move to LA?
And before that?
That's Benicio's father.
He's in jail.
What do you do?
Like a limo driver?
You mean all those car chases and stuff?
Isn't that dangerous?
Where?
You should tell Benicio you're a stunt guy.
Aren't all little boys?
Would you like another glass?
Well, thank you for your help.
We're neighbors.
Either it doesn't start or it stalls.
How long has he been working for you?
That was my husband's lawyer on the phone.
Benicio wants you to put him to bed.
Who was that on the phone?
I'm sorry about the noise. I was going to leave a note under your door warning you we were having a party.
I wish you would. Maybe the cops'd show up and send everybody home.
The car works great by the way. Hasn't stalled once.
You want me to take that?
What can I get you?
Would you like some more chicken?
Don't you think that's enough?
Are you working on anything else?
Then why don't you go ahead and talk for all of us.
Benicio, it's time for bed -
Benicio, you heard me -
I'm sorry.
Are you going to be okay?
I tried to reach you. Standard's been -
I can't talk now. I have to go.
The car's working fine.
What are you, a bank? I work for a living.
Just tell me one thing. How did he talk you into it?
What are you talking about?
You're crazy. I don't even know you -
It doesn't work like that.
The blazing sun beats down. Driver walks through a long corridor of glinting cars.
Couldn't see much wrong with that. You beat the fastest lap by more than half a second.
Thing is -
That thing doesn't work.
Drive it.
Mama, can I go in the car?!
Sometimes.
No.
He's telling him if he doesn't leave the earth alone he'll fight him.
He's okay.
Disneyland.
Sure.
Okay.
My parole officer. He thinks he may have found me a job.
I can't take any of the credit. He's got a great mother.
He tells me you drive for the movies?
Must be pretty good?
No, we got it.
You want to come in, join us for a drink?
At this hour of night?
You got a minute? I want to -
Irene told me you'd fixed our car. How much do I owe you?
I do worry. I like to pay my debts.
I was thinking of trading her in for a new car. Something fast and cheap.
Alright then, fast.
You must think I'm an asshole?
Where's Benicio?
Don't say anything to your mother, you understand? This is between you and me.
You ever been inside?
I owed some protection money in the joint.
What did you say you were inside for?
I'll pay him out of what's left of my share. I can't do something like this on my own.
You don't get it either do you, Benicio?
Now this is what I call a deluxe chicken.
Forget Disneyland. I'm gonna take you and your mother away from this bullshit city -
Your papa's got it all figured out -
What are you talking about?
Suddenly she turns around as she hears her apartment door open.
I've got you to do this fucking job for me, why do I need to pay someone else?
You look like you're hard to work with?
What's to understand? It's my score. Either you sign on or you don't.
Where are you going?
They'll bring it. Sit down.
Standard, why don't you hire a fucking taxi cab?
So, what does he mean?
Standard, get Blanche her coca cola.
You still interested?
Fuck you -
Don't worry. They'll come get it. You don't know who you're fucking with -
Mr. Paolozzi, I owe you this guy. Just give me the okay and I'll -
Mr. Paolozzi -
They've forgotten my Coke.
I've no idea.
I already told you everything -
Just a couple months. We were fooling around. I've never been mixed up in anything like this -
He told me it was Chris, but I just called him Cook.
Driver pauses, still on the phone to Benicio.
Driver leans against his car, talking on Cook's cell phone.
Can I ask what this is about?
And that would be?
Which floor?
Yeah?
Yeah, I know. I'm kind of busy here.
Get the hell out of my -
Anything else?
